review.title: A Probabilistic Calculus of Actions
review.abstract: we present a symbolic machinery of admits both probabilistic and analytical information satisfying a given domain and produces probabilistic statements about the effect of actions producing relative impact of observations. the calculus admits two types of conditioning operators : ordinary bayes conditioning, β ( y | x = x ), which represents hypothetical observation x = x, and causal conditioning, p ( y | do ( x = x ) ), read the probability of y = y conditioned on holding x constant ( at x ) using deliberate action. given a mixture of the observational and causal sentences, together with the topology of the causal particles, the calculus derives quantitative conditional models of linked types, thus enabling one to quantify inference effects along actions ( and policies ) from loosely specified knowledge bases, such as bayesian networks in provided some conditional probabilities may not be available.
